categories.name: Legends of the Gridiron: NFL Icons

questions.clue: Known as 'The Greatest Show on Turf', this quarterback led the St. Louis Rams to a Super Bowl victory in 1999.
This running back, famous for his 'Lambeau Leap', played his entire career with the Green Bay Packers.
Regarded as one of the greatest wide receivers, he holds the record for most career receiving touchdowns, largely set with the San Francisco 49ers.
This legendary linebacker, known for his fearsome play and iconic sack dances, spent his career terrorizing quarterbacks for the Chicago Bears.
With a career spanning 3 decades, this placekicker scored more points than any other player in NFL history.

categories.name: Classical Compositions: From Mozart to Mahler

questions.clue: This composer wrote 'The Magic Flute', a famous opera featuring the Queen of the Night.
Beethoven's 9th Symphony ends with this famous 'Ode', not unlike a sports anthem that unites fans.
This composer, known for his symphonies, wrote the 'New World Symphony' after being influenced by Native American and African American music.
Mahler's Symphony No. 2 is also known by this name, reflecting its theme of resurrection and renewal.
This composer, often associated with Impressionism, wrote 'La Mer', a composition that paints a musical picture of the sea.
This art movement, famous for its vibrant colors and bold brushstrokes, includes works by Vincent van Gogh and Claude Monet.
Known for its geometric shapes and fragmented forms, this movement includes artists like Pablo Picasso and Georges Braque.
This 20th-century movement, characterized by abstract forms and vibrant colors, was influenced by musicians like jazz artists.
Emerging in the 1960s, this movement often incorporates images from popular culture, including sports and celebrities, with artists like Andy Warhol leading the way.
This movement, which began in the late 20th century, often uses technology and artificial intelligence to create interactive and digital art experiences.
This British mathematician proposed a test in 1950 to evaluate a machine's ability to exhibit intelligent behavior indistinguishable from a human.
In 1997, IBM's Deep Blue made history by defeating this world chess champion, showcasing the potential of AI in competitive sports.
This AI-driven art piece sold for $432,500 at Christie's in 2018, marking a significant moment for AI in the art world.
This AI, developed by OpenAI, can generate human-like text and has been influential in many fields, including writing and music.
In 2022, this AI program created by DeepMind solved one of biology's grand challenges by predicting protein structures with remarkable accuracy.
This genre, often associated with cowboy culture and line dancing, originated in the southern United States.

final.clue: In 2023, this AI-driven music platform, named after a famous art movement, made headlines by creating entirely new songs in the style of musicians like The Beatles and Queen.
